instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-3115-B no green light, PPBUS_G3H 12.3V
threads.message:
This board has had some liquid damage on it, sticky crap but not much corrosion.
No or a dim green light, wont power on.

PPBUS_G3H is 12.3V
PP3V42_G3H is 3.42V
PP5V_S3 is 0 V. Resistance to ground ~22k

SMC_BCACOK is fluctuating between 3.0 and 3.3V. not steady.
SMC_RESET_L is 3.42V

[B]already done:[/B]
Fluxed up and heating the SMC to pre-reflow temp. no change
Fluxed and reflowed SMC. still the same deal.

I'm thinking that next on the list may be replacing the SMC, but I'd like to be a bit more sure of that before going there.

threads.title: 820-3115-B no green light, PPBUS_G3H 12.3V
threads.message: Replace U7000. It is PPBUS G3H buck controller and sends out BCACOK. PPBUS is low so may be an SMC but let's try the ISL first.

threads.title: 820-3115-B no green light, PPBUS_G3H 12.3V
threads.message:
U7000 replaced. I've checked everything on BC_ACOK / CHGR_ACOK. R5087 is 470k as it should be. I've lifted U6901 to see if that was mucking it up, but BCACOK stays the same with it removed.

However, I just noticed that PPCHGR_DCIN is fluctuating as well. Its sitting at 16.7V most of the time, but sometimes dips down to 16.0V for a moment. This carries all the way to PP18V5_DCIN, where I get 17.1V dropping down to 16.5 every 10 seconds or so.

note: I've already tried swapping the DC in board and the charger.

threads.title: 820-3115-B no green light, PPBUS_G3H 12.3V
threads.message: Dead SMC or crap under it.

threads.title: 820-3115-B no green light, PPBUS_G3H 12.3V
threads.message:
I've replaced the SMC. Green light went on, machine powered on with fan spinning continuously but no image on screen and no blacklight.
Now that I've had it on and off a few times, it no longer powers on. Instead, it takes 20 seconds or longer for the green light to come on, but its not steady. Keeps on blinking.
Did I botch the SMC replacement or might something else be wrong?

edit - it still powers up right away from another charger.

PPBUS_G3H still 12.3
PP3V42_G3H - 3.45
PP5V_S3 - 5.05V

no gong (right or left speaker attached), no image on external screen.

LCD_IG_PWR_EN is at 0V, but no short to ground. (90k). But I'm guessing I need the gong before looking at the LCD, right?

threads.title: 820-3115-B no green light, PPBUS_G3H 12.3V
threads.message: 12.3V on PPBUS_G3H could be a bad SMC or ISL, also could be a bad soldering on the SMC when it was replaced...  CPU Vcore present???? Any activity on USB???

threads.title: 820-3115-B no green light, PPBUS_G3H 12.3V
threads.message:
I'm guessing cpu core being ok or not is this one: [TABLE="border: 0, cellspacing: 0"]
[TR]

 			[TD="align: left"] [/TD]
 			[TD="align: left"]3,29V[/TD]
 		[/TR]
[/TABLE]

I've replaced the ISL already. checked a couple of things: [TABLE="border: 0, cellspacing: 0"]
[TR]
[TD="align: left"]PPCHGR_DCIN[/TD]
 			[TD="align: left"]16,4V[/TD]
 		[/TR]
[TR]

 			[TD="align: left"]4V[/TD]
 		[/TR]
[TR]
[TD="align: left"]SMBUS_CHGR_SDA[/TD]
 			[TD="align: left"]hmm[/TD]
 		[/TR]
[TR]

 			[TD="align: left"]3,46V[/TD]
 		[/TR]
[TR]

[TR]

 		[/TR]

 			[TD="align: left"]5V[/TD]

[/TABLE]

I checked SMBUS_CHGR_SDA on the scope. It looks different when compared to a functional 820-2936-B I had lying around. Should be similar, I'd think.

[ATTACH alt="smbus_chgr_sda-820-3115-bad.jpg" type="full" width="320px"]26048._xfImport[/ATTACH]

[B]SMBUS_CHGR_SDA on 820-3115 with PPBUS_G3H at 12.3[/B]

[ATTACH alt="smbus_chgr_sda-820-2936-ok.jpg" type="full" width="320px"]26049._xfImport[/ATTACH]

[B]SMBUS_CHGR_SDA on 820-2936 which boots into OS (but is very slow)[/B]

Thats a bidirectional line, but perhaps someone has seen this before and knows whether the most likely suspect is ISL or SMC..

What do you want me to check when you say activity on USB?

threads.title: 820-3115-B no green light, PPBUS_G3H 12.3V
threads.message: CPU Vcore present on L7510?

threads.title: 820-3115-B no green light, PPBUS_G3H 12.3V
threads.message: Yes it is, 1.12V

threads.title: 820-3115-B no green light, PPBUS_G3H 12.3V
threads.message:
I decided to spend some time looking through the schematic in the hopes of gaining some understanding.
This isn't really relevant to this particular board, but bear with me..

I see PPVCORE_S0_CPU_PH1 found at L7510 comes from Q7510, which requires input on the following pins to generate PPVCORE_S0_CPU_PH1_L: [TABLE="border: 0, cellspacing: 0"]
[TR]
[TD="align: left"]PPVIN_S0_CPUIMVP[/TD]
 		[/TR]
[TR]
[TD="align: left"]CPUIMVP_BOOT1[/TD]
 		[/TR]
[TR]
[TD="align: left"]CPUIMVP_PHASE1[/TD]
 		[/TR]
[TR]
[TD="align: left"]CPUIMVP_LGATE1[/TD]
 		[/TR]
[/TABLE]

PPVIN_S0_CPUIMVP comes from PP1V05_S0
The other three inputs all come from U7400

U7400 deals in CPUIMVP and other CPU related stuff and has a bunch of pins it wants to see something on. Those inputs are several power rails, a bunch of lines from the CPU and a couple from (or at least related to) Q7510 and Q7560, which are part of the phased power supply to the CPU. Did I miss anytihng so far?
Am I correct in saying that measuring L7510 or L7520 lets me see whether U7400 [B]and[/B] the CPU are working?

threads.title: 820-3115-B no green light, PPBUS_G3H 12.3V
threads.message: If Vcore is present all power rails will be OK. Beep without RAM?

threads.title: 820-3115-B no green light, PPBUS_G3H 12.3V
threads.message: No beep without RAM (only one speaker connected, but I take it it should beep on either one,right?)

threads.title: 820-3115-B no green light, PPBUS_G3H 12.3V
threads.message: Bass speaker connected ?

threads.title: 820-3115-B no green light, PPBUS_G3H 12.3V
threads.message: I just tried with both speakers, no beep.

threads.title: 820-3115-B no green light, PPBUS_G3H 12.3V
threads.message: So it is a brain dead board. Is PPBUS still at 12.3V?

threads.title: 820-3115-B no green light, PPBUS_G3H 12.3V
threads.message: Ppbus 12.25v

threads.title: 820-3115-B no green light, PPBUS_G3H 12.3V
threads.message: Doubt this will be of any help but what is SMC_RESET_L at?

threads.title: 820-3115-B no green light, PPBUS_G3H 12.3V
threads.message: its at 3.4V

threads.title: 820-3115-B no green light, PPBUS_G3H 12.3V
threads.message: This could be anything at this point, although I'm not trusting that SMC job you did.

threads.title: 820-3115-B no green light, PPBUS_G3H 12.3V
threads.message: Agreed. Even with a dead CPU PPBUS should be 12.56 unless its shorted and holding it down

threads.title: 820-3115-B no green light, PPBUS_G3H 12.3V
threads.message:
I am also not trusting the SMC job I did. :rolleyes:
Or the SMC I used, of course, but when can you trust that?
I will use my other donor board's SMC for another try as soon as I have time. Will report back latah.

threads.title: 820-3115-B no green light, PPBUS_G3H 12.3V
threads.message:
I finally got around to replacing the SMC again. When removing the previous one, I noticed that three balls had merged. That may have happened during removal, but I probably bumped the SMC too hard when trying to see if the solder had melted while placing it. The merged balls were: LPC_AD<0>, LPC_AD<2> and SMC_WAKE_SCI_L

I grabbed another SMC from a donor board, reballed and placed that. Machine would now power on with quarter fan spin. Magsafe light slightly blinking. Every now and then it would go full fan spin, but no beep from speakers. Most of the time its just an endless loop of quarter fan spin.

I first wanted to rule out having messed up the SMC again so decided to replace it yet again, just to see if the behaviour would be the same. This time there were no merged balls when lifting the SMC, and placing the next one went smooth. The board is acting the same as with the second SMC, so I'm assuming the problem is somewhere else. Might be because of the first SMC job, or because there is simply another issue with the board.

Some measurements I took:

PPBUS_G3H = 12.58V
SMC_BCACOK = 3.27V
SMC_RESET_L = 3.4V
SMC_ONOFF_L = 3.45V
SMC_LID = 3.4V
L7510 = 0V

[B]Resistance to ground because of the previously merged SMC balls:[/B]
LPC_AD<0> to ground is about 230KOhm    
LPC_AD<2> to ground is 7.18MOhm    
SMC_WAKE_SCI_L to ground starts at 1k and goes up quickly

threads.title: 820-3115-B no green light, PPBUS_G3H 12.3V
threads.message: Power cycling can be anything. Was U2600 already replaced? Checked R7402/03? ALL_SYS_PWRGD pulsing high?

threads.title: 820-3115-B no green light, PPBUS_G3H 12.3V
threads.message:
I hadn't replaced U2600 yet, but I have now. Hasn't changed anything.

R7402/3 are 150/181kOhm
ALL_SYS_PWRGD is pulsing high

threads.title: 820-3115-B no green light, PPBUS_G3H 12.3V
threads.message: At this point it can be anything. Any knocked off component, any corroded trace/resistor. I really have no more ideas.

threads.title: 820-3115-B no green light, PPBUS_G3H 12.3V
threads.message: I'll inspect the whole thing and see if I find anything of interest. If nothing, I guess I'll have to give up on this one. Hate that :(
